channel.title: Versailles - Simple HTML/CSS Header & Navigation Bar

item.title: Versailles - Simple HTML/CSS Header & Navigation Bar
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:9, topic:546383”][quote author=John link=topic=665280.msg4447999#msg4447999 date=1409872249]

You need to add the

  • tags otherwise using the
      tag like you did is bad.

    • They were added, I wrapped anchor tags around them though.
    [/quote]
    That is invalid markup. The only direct child allowed inside an unordered list is a list item. The list item can have whatever it wants inside of it though.[/quote]
    You’re right, when I was reading up on HTML5 markup changes I misread one of the articles about list tags. Thanks for letting me know.

    Read full topic
item.source: Versailles - Simple HTML/CSS Header & Navigation Bar

item.title: Versailles - Simple HTML/CSS Header & Navigation Bar
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“John, post:4, topic:546383”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=665280.msg4447936#msg4447936 date=1409841829]
You need to add the

  • tags otherwise using the
      tag like you did is bad.
      [/quote]
      They were added, I wrapped anchor tags around them though. :)[/quote]
      That is invalid markup. The only direct child allowed inside an unordered list is a list item. The list item can have whatever it wants inside of it though.

    • Read full topic
item.source: Versailles - Simple HTML/CSS Header & Navigation Bar

item.title: Versailles - Simple HTML/CSS Header & Navigation Bar
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“voetbal645, post:7, topic:546383”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665280.msg4450614#msg4450614 date=1411068632]

Make your navigation bar in div tags. like this.

Wouldn’t that defeat the purpose of having the nav tag…
http://html5doctor.com/nav-element/

The nav element represents a section of a page that links to other pages or to parts within the page: a section with navigation links. Not all groups of links on a page need to be in a nav element only sections that consist of major navigation blocks are appropriate for the nav element. In particular, it is common for footers to have a list of links to various key parts of a site, but the footer element is more appropriate in such cases, and no nav element is necessary for those links.

^Source > http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/sections.html#the-nav-element
[/quote]
Indeed your right sorry for the mistake. We only worked with div’s so far thought it was the right way. I asked my teacher and he said that we will see nav later so.[/quote]
Ah. Yeah a div can do anything you need, (I remember there was one dude on these forums who made his we pages ONLY using div tags…) but you don’t always want to use them, because there are other tags that could suit your needs a bit better.

Read full topic
item.source: Versailles - Simple HTML/CSS Header & Navigation Bar

item.title: Versailles - Simple HTML/CSS Header & Navigation Bar
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Ashi:

You need to add the

  • tags otherwise using the
      tag like you did is bad.

    • They were added, I wrapped anchor tags around them though.

    Ambokile:

    Did you steal this like your last piece of work?

    My last piece of work was not stolen, it was based off of an image I found on Google searching for unique templates. If you find the need to be aggressive and not take note that everyone bases their work off of others when they begin then don’t bother posting. You of all people as a programmer should know this. This header was based off of a design I found on Codepen.

    Read full topic

item.title: Versailles - Simple HTML/CSS Header & Navigation Bar
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

HTML:

[code=html5]

Versailles

  • Home
    •
  • Home
    •
  • Home
    •
  • Home
    •
  • Home
    •
  • Home
    •
[/code]

CSS:

body { margin: 0; } header { background: #393d48; } header h1 { color: #d7ceb2; font-family: 'Bazar', serif; font-variant: small-caps; letter-spacing: 1rem; text-shadow: 3px 3px 0 #2c2e38, 5px 5px 0 #5c5f72; font-size: 72px; line-height: 1.0; text-align: center; margin: 0; padding: 2.4rem 0; cursor: default; } header h1:before { content: '\2663'; } header h1:after { content: '\2663'; } nav { border-top: 2px solid #d7ceb2; background: #393d48; width: 100%; height: 53px; } nav ul { list-style: none; margin: 7px auto; } nav ul li { display: inline-block; padding: 5px 40px; line-height: 25px; border: 2px transparent solid; border-radius: 12px; transition: border .3s linear; } nav ul li:hover { border: 2px #d7ceb2 solid; } nav a { color: #d7ceb2; text-decoration: none; font-family: 'Open Sans', sans-serif; text-transform: uppercase; }

Read full topic
